spam module#

spam.grid_seach_RandomForestClassifier(param_grid, xtrain_vect, ytrain, xtest_vect, ytest)[source]#

Function to make a grid seach on order to find the random forest best parameters :param param_grid: list of parameters on which a grid seach is made in order to find the best parameters which will be use to fit our classifier :param xtrain_vect: list of vectors which will be use to train the model. Each vector represents an entire doc ou message :param xtest_vect: list of vectors which will be use to evaluate the model. Each vector represents an entire doc ou message :param ytrain: label of traing dataset :param ytest: label of evaluation dataset

Return the best parameters and the the best model

spam.grid_seach_embadding_algo(param_grid, xtrain, ytrain, xtest, ytest, algo)[source]#

Transform à test data to numerical vectors. Each word à turn into a vector :param param_grid: list of parameters on which a grid seach is made in order to find the best parameters which will be use to embed the text :param xtrain: text data obtain after preprocessing :param ytrain: label of each document :param xtest: text data on which the grid search parameters are evaluate :param ytest: label of text data :param algo: the algorithm chosen to embef the doc ( here we are “word2vec”, “FastText”,Doc2vec”)

spam.main()[source]#

The main functions

spam.preprocessing()[source]#

Function for loading and preprocessing the dataset Return the preprocess dataframe. Each document is turn into a list of tokens

spam.remove_stopwords(text)[source]#

Function for tokenizing and removing stopwords :param text: the row text to tokenize and remove stopword

spam.score(model, xtest_vect, ytest)[source]#

Function for scoring the model after training

spam.visualisation(xtrain_vect, ytrain, method, n_component=2)[source]#

Function for visualizing the embedding vectors.

Parameters:

  • xtrain_vect (list) – List of vectors which will be used to train the model. Each vector represents an entire document or message.

  • ytrain – Label of the training dataset.

  • method (str) – Method for reducing the dimensionality of the training vectors (here we are using only two methods: “pca” and “tsne”).

  • n_component (int) – Number of components to preserve.
